reviewText: This was an engrossing documentary.  I thoroughly enjoyed it.  I was particularly moved by Thomas Borge and many of the personal interviews.

I was working in Central America with a non-profit company based in Connecticut while the war in Nicaragua was ending and spent several months in Nicaragua, a beautiful country with many lakes and volcanoes, after the victory of the Sandinistas, young men and women who defeated Reagan's Contras.
Nicaragua No Pasaran  (They Will Not Enter) is an excellent DVD by Australian journalist David Bradbury, recently released. I recommend it highly. If you are looking for a vacation spot, you might consider Nicaragua.
